summary: TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 2003 GEORGIE BOY CRUISE MASTER RV.  THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO AN AUTHORIZED DEALER FOR REPAIR.  THE TECHNICIAN OBSERVED SEVERAL MASSIVE CRACKS ON THE ROTORS OF ALL FOUR BRAKES.  THE ROTORS WERE REPLACED AT THE COST OF $2,974.25.  THE VIN WAS EXCLUDED FROM NHTSA CAMPAIGN ID NUMBER 03V041000 (SERVICE BRAKES, HYDRAULIC;SWITCHES, BRAKE WARNING).   THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 42,453 AND CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 42,924.   UPDATED 3/24/09 *CN  UPDATED 03/25/09.*JB

HI, I JUST PURCHASED A GEORGIE BOY CRUISE MASTER 2004.  THE ORIGINAL AXLE WEIGHTS ARE AS FOLLOWS:  IGHT FRONT = 3485,  LEFT FRONT   = 3620,  RIGHT REAR = 5320,  LEFT REAR  = 6240.    THE LEFT SIDE WEIGHS 9,860.  THE RIGHT SIDE WEIGHS 8,805.  THE LEFT SIDE WEIGHTS 1,055 POUNDS MORE THAN THE RIGHT SIDE.      IS THE VEHICLE SAFE TO DRIVE WITH THESE AXLE WEIGHTS?   WHAT PROBLEMS COULD BE CREATED BY THESE AXLE WEIGHTS?     THESE ARE QUESTIONS I CANNOT ANSWER.  WHEN I CALLED GEORGIE BOY THE REPRESENTATIVE OFFER NO SOLUTION.  THE VEHICLE NOTICABLY LEANS TO THE LEFT.  I DON'T WANT TO FLIP IN ORDER TO MAKE THIS AN ISSUE THAT IS PROPERLY ADDRESSED.     THANK YOU FOR YOUR REPLY.*AK
